fr.insarennes.learningbot.model

Class DecisionTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.insarennes.learningbot.model.DecisionTree

  • public class DecisionTree
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the decision tree, which is the core of the learning process. There are several methods which give simple answer to know the action the robot should perform. See DecisionTreeParser to read a decision tree from XML.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int MIN_HIT_PERCENTAGE
      Percentage (between 0 and 100) of how many successful hits are needed (at least) to allow firing Ex : On all shots (hit+miss), I'll shoot as long as there is at least 30% of successful hits.

      • MIN_HIT_PERCENTAGE

        public static final int MIN_HIT_PERCENTAGE
        Percentage (between 0 and 100) of how many successful hits are needed (at least) to allow firing Ex : On all shots (hit+miss), I'll shoot as long as there is at least 30% of successful hits.

      • doWeShoot

        public boolean doWeShoot(LearningBot robot)
        Should we shoot at the other competitor, regarding combat context ?
        Parameters:
        robot - The current robot, the one wondering if it should fire.
        Returns:
        True if yes, False if no

      • whereDoWeGo

        public java.lang.String whereDoWeGo(LearningBot robot)
        DEPRECATED Where the robot should go ?
        Parameters:
        robot - The current robot.
        Returns:
        The direction to take as a string : "forward", "backward", "right", "left", "stay"

      • whatGunOrientation

        public java.lang.String whatGunOrientation(LearningBot robot)
        DEPRECATED Where the robot gun should point ?
        Parameters:
        robot - The current robot.
        Returns:
        The direction the gun should take as a string : "front", "back", "right", "left"
